creator.name: Comité tot de Zaken van de Koloniën en Bezittingen op de Kust van Guinea en in Amerika / West-Indisch Comité
creator.name_english: Committee for the Affairs of the Colonies on the Guinea Coast and in America / West India Committee
creator.his_func: As the cooperation between the Council for the Colonies and the Board of Berbice and the Society of Suriname was not going well, it was decided to set up one general administration for all colonies. In 1795 the Committee for the Affairs of the Colonies on the Guinea Coast and in America, or West India Committee for short, was established. It had its seat in The Hague and consisted of 25 members, delegated by the respective provinces. Three departments were formed: Policy and Justice; Militia and Defence; Commerce and Finances.
